column1: Pyt-Yakh (Russian: Пыть-Ях) is a town in Khanty–Mansi Autonomous Okrug
column3: located on the east bank of the Bolshoy Balyk River

column1: The town was formed by merging the settlements of Mamontovo and Pyt-Yakh in 1990. The name of the town means "place of good people" in the Khanty language.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the town of okrug significance of Pyt-Yakh—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the town of okrug significance of Pyt-Yakh is incorporated as Pyt-Yakh Urban Okrug.

column1: The town's economy is based on oil and natural gas extraction.
Дума Ханты-Мансийского автономного округа — Югры. Закон №43-оз от 7 июля 2004 г. «Об административно-территориальном устройстве Ханты-Мансийского автономного округа — Югры и порядке его изменения»
